result.execSummary:
The defendant Nikki S. Thundercloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 13CF178.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bond on file.
Attend and successfully complete alcohol assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment within 30 days, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.
Undergo a mental health evaluation, if agent recommends.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

The defendant shall cooperate with and participate in any assessments, treatment and/or programming as determined appropriate based on the defendant's assessed risk and criminogenic needs, and as directed by the Department of Corrections.  Comply with order in CHIPS case.  May only have supervised contact with her children until authorized otherwise by social services.  Jail credit of 27 days granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nikki S. Thundercloud

defendant.name: Thundercloud, Nikki S.
defendant.address: W8850 Thundercloud Road, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 30, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on April 21, 2014 at 11:00 am.

This bond includes case 13CF190, 13CF178 and 14CF37.: Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals: Janice B; Benjamin B, Zekia H. and Jaysen S. She may have contact with Benjamin B. for the purpose of the children and finances as approved by the Social Worker. She is granted supervised visits with her children.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to leave Jackson County.    Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
